row.entry: Create a workunit from an ecl file, archive, or dll
Add a workunit to a query set
Remove a query from a query set
Run the given ecl file, archive, dll, wuid, or query
Deactivate the given query alias name
List or manipulate queries and querysets
aborts one or more workunits from the given WUID or job name
returns the status of a given workunit or job name. If more than one is found, a list returns.
returns the workunit name from the given WUID.
returns the WUID(s) of the given workunit job name.

sect3.title: ecl.ini
sect3.para: Many options can be placed in a file called ecl.ini in the same directory as the executable. Options that do not change very often should be put in the ini file. For example:
In some examples below, we'll assume ecl.ini has the above content.

row.entry: We do not recommend storing your password in the INI file (which is clear text). The password is included in the INI file for these examples to simplify the example code.

sect3.para: The following options can be provided in an ini file: eclWatchIP, eclWatchPort, eclUserName, eclPassword, activateDefault, waitTimeout, resultLimit.
Evaluation of options follows this order of precedence:

sect3.title: Environment Variables
sect3.para: Some options can be stored in Environment Variables on your machine. The following options are supported:
sect3.programlisting: ECL_WATCH_IP ECL_WATCH_PORT ECL_USER_NAME ECL_PASSWORD ECL_WAIT_TIMEOUT ECL_RESULT_LIMIT

row.entry: We do not recommend storing your password in an Environment Variable unless your system is secured.

sect2.title: ecl deploy
sect2.programlisting: ecl deploy roxie findperson.ecl --name=FindPersonService ecl deploy roxie ArchiveQuery.xml --name=FindPersonService ecl deploy roxie libW20150914-125557.so --name=FindPersonService ecl deploy roxie - --name=FindPersonService
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: Creates a workunit on the HPCC system from the given ECL text, file, archive, shared object, or dll. The workunit is created in the compiled state.
The target cluster to which to deploy
The ECL text file to deploy
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to deploy
Specifies object should be read from stdin
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ECL query to HPCC as text rather than as a generated archive
Add path to locations to search for ecl imports
Add path to locations to search for system libraries

sect2.title: ecl publish
sect2.programlisting: ecl publish roxie findperson.ecl --name=FindPersonService -A ecl publish roxie W20150914-125557 --name=FindPersonService -A ecl publish roxie libW20150914-125557.so --name=FindPersonService -A ecl publish roxie ArchiveQuery.xml --name=FindPersonService -A ecl publish roxie - --name=FindPersonService --activate ecl publish roxie findperson.ecl --name=FindPersonService --no-activate ecl publish roxie ArchiveQuery.xml --name=FindPersonService --no-activate
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: Publishes a query into a queryset. The query is created by adding a workunit to a queryset and assigning it a query name.
The target cluster to which to publish
The ECL text file to publish
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to publish
Specifies object should be read from stdin
Does not activate query when published
Specifies to not copy DFS file information for files referenced by the query
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster
Specifies to allow the use of foreign files in a Roxie query. If a Roxie query references foreign files and this is not enabled, publish will fail.
IP address or hostname of the remote Dali to use for remote logical file lookups.
Update local DFS info if remote DALI has changed
Process cluster from which to copy files
Value to set for query timeLimit configuration
Value to set for query warnTimeLimit configuration
Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
The priority for this query. Value can be LOW, HIGH, SLA, NONE. NONE will clear current setting.
A comment associated with this query
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ECL query to HPCC as text rather than as a generated archive
Sets the result limit for the query, defaults to 100
Override the definition of a global attribute 'name'
Add path to locations to search for ecl imports
Add path to locations to search for system libraries

sect2.title: ecl unpublish
sect2.programlisting: ecl unpublish roxie FindpersonService.1 ecl unpublish roxie "FindpersonService*"

row.entry: executes the supplied ecl unpublish command
The name of queryset containing query to unpublish
The query to remove from query set. Wildcards allowed, but must be in quotes (e.g., "MyQuery*" ).
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl run
sect2.programlisting: ecl run thor findperson.ecl --name=findperson --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ecl run thor W20150914-125557 --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ecl run thor findperson --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ecl run thor libW20150914-125557.so --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ecl run thor - --input=data.xml --wait=1000 ecl run thor findperson.ecl --input="<request><LName>JONES</LName></request>" ecl run thor findperson.ecl -I C:\MyECL\
sect2.para: A hyphen (-) specifies that the object should be read from stdin.

row.entry: executes the supplied ecl run command
The target cluster to which to publish
The ECL text file to run
The workunit dynamic linked library or shared object to run
Specifies object should be read from stdin
The file or xml content to use as query input
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
Sets the minimum severity for reporting exceptions. Possible severity levels are info, warning, or error. The default is info which returns all exceptions.
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The definition to use from legacy ECL repository
Send ECL query to HPCC as text rather than as a generated archive
Sets the result limit for the query, defaults to 100
set an ECL option (equivalent to #OPTION in ECL)
Add path to locations to search for ECL imports (e.g., -I C:\MyECL\ )
Add path to locations to search for system libraries

sect2.title: ecl activate
sect2.programlisting: ecl activate Roxie FindpersonService.4

row.entry: Activates a published query. This assigns a query to the active alias with the same name as the query.
The name of queryset containing query to activate
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl deactivate
sect2.programlisting: ecl deactivate Roxie FindpersonService

row.entry: Deactivates a published query by removing an active query alias from the given queryset.
The name of queryset containing alias to deactivate
The active alias to be removed from the queryset
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl queries list
sect2.programlisting: ecl queries list roxie ecl queries list roxie --target=roxie --show=A

row.entry: Displays a list of the queries in one or more querysets. If a cluster is provided the querysets associated with that cluster will be shown. If no queryset or cluster is specified all querysets are shown.
The name of queryset from which to list queries
The target cluster associated with the queries to list
Show only queries with matching flags
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl queries copy
sect2.programlisting: ecl queries copy thor/findperson thor2 --activate ecl queries copy //192.168.1.10:8010/thor/findperson thor

row.entry: Copies a query from one queryset to another. A query can be copied from one HPCC environment to another by using a path which begins with '//' followed by the IP or hostname and Port of the source ECL Watch and then followed by the source queryset and query.
Copy a query from one queryset to another
The path of the query to copy using the format: [//ip:port/]queryset/query or queryset/query.
The name of the queryset to which the query should be copied
The target cluster to associate with the remote workunit
Specifies to not copy DFS file information for files referenced by the query
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster
Specifies to allow the use of foreign files in a Roxie query. If a Roxie query references foreign files and this is not enabled, copy will fail.
Whether to overwrite existing information - true if present
Value to set for query timeLimit configuration
Value to set for query warnTimeLimit configuration
Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
Maximum time to wait for cluster finish updating (in ms)
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl queries copy-set
sect2.programlisting: ecl queries copy-set roxie1 roxie2 ecl queries copy-set roxie1 roxie2 --all ecl queries copy-set roxie1 roxie2 --clone-active-state

row.entry: Copies a set of queries from one target to another.
Copy a set of queries from one target to another.
Target cluster from which to copy queries.
Target cluster to copy queries to.
Specifies to copy both active and inactive queries. If omitted, only active are copied.
Specifies to not copy DFS file information for files referenced by the query
IP address or hostname of the remote Dali to use for logical file lookups.
Process cluster from which to copy files.
Make copied queries active on target if they are active on the source.
Specifies to allow the use of foreign files in a Roxie query. If a Roxie query references foreign files and this is not enabled, copy will fail.
Whether to overwrite existing DFS information - true if present
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

row.entry: Set or update query configuration values
The name of the target queryset
Specifies to not request a reload of the Roxie cluster

Value to set for query memoryLimit configuration. Format <mem> as 500000B, 550K, 100M, 10G, or 1T, etc.
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl packagemap add
sect2.programlisting: ecl packagemap add -s=192.168.1.10 roxie mypackagemap.pkg ecl packagemap add roxie mypackagemap.pkg --overwrite ecl packagemap add roxie mypackagemap.pkg --daliip=192.168.11.11

row.entry: Adds a packagemap to the target cluster
The target to associate the packagemap with
The name of the file containing packagemap information.
IP address or hostname of the remote Dali to use for logical file lookups
Whether to overwrite existing information - true if present
Specifies to allow the use of foreign files. If a packagemap references foreign files and this is not enabled, packagemap add will fail.
id of package map - defaults to filename if not specified
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

row.entry: The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)

sect2.title: ecl packagemap info
sect2.programlisting: ecl packagemap info roxie

row.entry: The target containing the packagemap to retrieve
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.

sect2.title: ecl packagemap validate
sect2.programlisting: ecl packagemap validate roxie mypackagemap.pkg ecl packagemap validate roxie --active
sect2.para: The packagemap validate command verifies that :

listitem.para: Referenced superkeys have subfiles defined (warns if no subfiles exist)
All referenced queries exist in the current Roxie queryset
All Roxie queries are defined in the package

sect2.para: The result will also list any files that are used by queries but not mapped in the packagemap.
Filename, --active, and --pmid are mutually exclusive. The --active or --pmid options validate a packagemap that has already been added instead of a local file.

The --queryid option checks the files in a query instead of all the queries in the target queryset. This is quicker when you only need to validate the files for a single query.
ecl packagemap validate
Calls the packagemap validate command.
Actions
validate
Validates packagemap info
Arguments
filename
The filename containing the packagemap info to validate
target
The target containing the packagemap to validate
Options
-v, --verbose
Output additional tracing information
-s, --server
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
--active
Validates the packagemap that is active for the given target
--pmid=<packagemapid>
Validates the given packagemap
--queryid
Validate the files for the given queryid if they are mapped in the packagemap
--port
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
-ssl
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
-u, --username
The username (if necessary)
-pw, --password
The password (if necessary)

List what would be installed, but do not copy
Install even if required dependencies missing
Do not remove any previous versions of the bundle

row.entry: The name of an installed bundle
List what would be removed, but do not remove them
Uninstall even if other bundles are dependent on this
Specify a version of the bundle

Report details of each installed bundle

row.entry: Makes a specified version of a bundle active
The name of a bundle file
The version of the bundle to make active, or "none"

sect2.programlisting: ecl roxie unused-files myroxie

Exclude files referenced in active packagemaps
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)

sect2.title: ecl abort

row.entry: aborts one or more Workunits from the given WUID or job name
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)

sect2.title: ecl status
sect2.programlisting: ecl status -wu W20150516-111213 ecl status -n MyJob

The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)

sect2.title: ecl getwuid

row.entry: returns the WUID(s) for a given job name. If more than one is found, a list returns.
Integer to set result limit, default is 100
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)

sect2.title: ecl getname
sect2.programlisting: ecl getname -wu W20140516-111213 ecl getname -wu W201407*

row.entry: returns the job name for a given workunit.
This sets the result limit. This is useful when using wildcards in a request. (Default is 100)
The IP Address or hostname of ESP server running ECL Watch services
Use SSL to secure the connection to the server.
The ECL Watch services port (Default is 8010)
